intro: Anthopogon barbatus, commonly known as the hairy tansy, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellowish-green flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in dry meadows and rocky soils, preferring full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine, stiff hairs, which contribute to its common name. Anthopogon barbatus is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported antiseptic and anti-inflammatory properties.
